formattedAddress: 389 South End Ave, New York, NY 10280, USA
adrFormatAddress: 389 South End Ave, New York, NY 10280, USA

originalText.text:
The property management is not worthy the rental price. They are fully disconnected from sale and the property management.

My self-inspect before the move in finds a lot of problems and submits to property management to fix. They acknowledge the issues, but it becomes worse. The door of bath room is not fixed and a lot of decoration materials are still in the room. It’s really hard to imagine it.

Heating doesn't work as warm-proof of the building is a problem. In my apartment there are many cracks on the wall and keeping warming is hard to achieve, so it cause $500 electric bill.

originalText.text: This place is the worst!!! My friend spent time there during thanksgiving holiday. She was harassed, abused and racially profiled in the apartment building. DO NOT STAY IN THIS PLACE!!! FOR THE LOVE OF EVERYTHING DON’T EVEN THINK ABOUT IT. Let’s not talk about the bugs in the room and how management tried to gaslit my friend, telling her “it was just a couple insects” You are better off staying in a car than this place.

originalText.text:
I had a seamless move-in experience at Gateway Apartments, thanks to the outstanding help from the leasing manager, Kireolos. He was incredibly responsive and helpful from start to finish.

The apartment itself is fantastic, and the community is welcoming. I'm thrilled with my choice to live here and highly recommend Gateway Apartments to anyone looking for a great place to call home.

originalText.text:
Avoid this rental building! Worst building in Battery Park.  Management team is unprofessional, the elevators are constantly breaking, expect long lines to use them and the ongoing repair process will take months! (Maybe years)

The elevators run at over capacity in rush hours, which is clearly a safety concern (some days they all/most stop working).  The security/cleaning crew  is super friendly and helpful, but management and overall experience is terrible.

originalText.text: Please beware of harassment and racial profiling if you are to live in or recommend this apartment to anyone. General manager Greg Tumminiki and furthermore, the corporate office, does not take racism as a serious priority in correcting. A friend of my family, who happens to be an elderly African American woman in her mid sixties, was staying with a friend who lives at this location and on two occasions she was racially profiled, verbally harassed and physically assaulted by the maintenance man named Nestor and a security guard named John. The maintenance man Nestor cursed the elderly woman and pushed her, saying that she didn’t belong in the building or have a right to be using the property’s facilities. When she tried to record the incident, Nestor pushed her and tried to take her cellphone away. Hearing this news about a so called luxury apartment and the way they treat African Americans, especially the elderly, was disturbing and disgraceful. To all thinking about moving here, please be aware of this and the danger of living in a building that not only allows but reinforces racism and discrimination, in their lack of empathy for this case and assistance in further investigating this incident internally.
